Lyrics: Esta é de loor de Santa María.
Direct Translation: This is in praise of Holy Mary.

Poetic Translation: O, poets and musicians,
To Her in pure submission
Why do you not give praises?

Direct Translation: If you well know your art,
Poetic Translation: If skilled at your vocation,

Direct Translation: Why do you not praise Her
Poetic Translation: To Her who brought salvation
Why do you not give praises?
To Her who gives us glory,
Whose grace is laudatory,
Why do you not give praises?
With truth in every notion,
She feels our deep emotion;
Why do you not give praises?

Lyrics: A que é mais que bõa
Poetic Translation: To Her whose virtues hearten,

Direct Translation: Her who is more than good
Poetic Translation: Through whom God grants us pardon,

Direct Translation: And through whom God grants pardon?
Poetic Translation: Why do you not give praises?
To Her who brings consolement
In life and death’s condolement
Why do you not give praises?

Lyrics: A que faz o que mórre
Poetic Translation: To Her who comes to aid us

Direct Translation: Her who causes the one who dies to live
Poetic Translation: And from our death conveyed us
Why do you not give praises?

Lyrics: Alfonso X el Sabio, King of Castile and León
Direct Translation: Alfonso. Songs of Holy Mary of Alfonso X, the Wise: A Translation of the Cantigas de Santa Maria. Trans. Kathleen Kulp-Hill. Tempe, AZ: Arizona Center for Medieval and Renaissance Studies, 2000. Print.
Poetic Translation: Carol Anne Perry Lagemann
